Event Name: HSR25-28 Invitation for Bids for Ballast
Description: 08/22/2025: The California High-Speed Rail Authority (Authority) anticipates releasing a new Invitation for Bids (IFB) to purchase commoditized ballast (crushed igneous rock) materials necessary to complete the First Construction Segment of its high-speed rail track. A draft IFB is available for review as an attachment to this Cal-eProcure event. This draft IFB will be considered for approval and official release by the Authority's Board of Directors at its meeting scheduled for August 28, 2025, and is subject to change and approval by the Authority's Board of Directors. Posting of this draft IFB does not constitute acceptance of bids. The draft IFB or its approval, if granted by the Board of Directors, does not constitute a release of the final IFB. Release of the final IFB will occur via notice and posting on Cal-eProcure. Questions regarding this procurement may be submitted only upon final approval of IFB by the Board of Directors and release on the California State Contract Register. Each materials contract will be issued through multiple Notices to Proceed (NTPs) as described below. The estimated cumulative value for all materials contracts (steel OCS poles, rail, concrete ties, ballast, OCS system components, and fiber optic cable) is not-to-exceed $507.1 million for NTP 1. - NTP 1: The initial authorization to be issued for the manufacture and supply of Materials for use in construction on the 119-mile First Construction Section. - NTP 2: To be issued at the Authority's option for the manufacture and supply of Materials for use in construction on the northern extension (Merced to Madera). - NTP 3: To be issued at the Authority's option for the manufacture and supply of Materials for use in construction on the southern extension (Poplar Avenue in the County of Kern to Bakersfield). The scope of work for this specific procurement and resulting contract is to provide Ballast materials, composed of crushed igneous rock, for use in construction on the 119-mile First Construction Section, with an estimated lead time of two to three weeks for NTP 1. General requirements for each material are provided in the IFB and draft agreement. The Contractor shall not perform any Work unless the Authority, in its sole discretion, issues a Notice to Proceed (NTP) and Purchase Order for such work. The actual amount of Work requested by the Authority is subject to the availability of funding. In addition, all materials must be newly manufactured goods and conform to the technical specifications provided by the Authority. All materials supplied must be Buy America and Build America, Buy America Act (BABA) compliant, in accordance with 49 U.S.C. § 22905 and 2 C.F.R. part 184. Information regarding the Pre-Bid Conference and Small Business Workshop is available on the Authority's website. Event Name: Request for Qualifications (RFQ) Cal Expo Stadium Project #B250008

Pre Bid Conference.Location: 1600 Exposition Blvd, Sacramento CA 95815 Gate 12
Pre Bid Conference.Comments: THE MANDATORY CONFERENCE AND SITE INSPECTION ORIGINALLY SCHEDULED FOR FRIDAY, OCTOBER 10 HAS BEEN POSTPONED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE. ADDENDUM IS ATTACHED.THE BID DUE DATE CHANGED. ONLY PREQUALIFIED FIRMS WILL BE INVITED (REFER TO THE ATTAC

Description: READ THE NEW NOTICE TO CONTRACTORS attached. The mandatory conference and site inspection has been postponed until further notice. Refer to the attachment. The State of California, acting through the Board of Trustees of The California State University, hereinafter called Trustees or BOT, on behalf of Sacramento State University, hereinafter called University, is seeking Design-Builders (Proposers) to provide design and construction services for the project referenced above (Project). The Trustees will select Design-Builder based on qualifications and proposed fees (a design competition is not utilized). Post award, the Design-Builder and the University will work to jointly select an Architect based on qualifications and proposed design fees (best value). The University will then issue a modification to the Phase 1 agreement to reflect the final design fee. Currently, the University is requesting that interested bidders who are not already prequalified with CSU or who may need to request a prequalification limit increase, start the prequalification process. The formal Request for Qualifications is forthcoming, however interested proposers should not wait until the RFQ is posted to start the prequalification process. The Project consists of: A 22,000-seat NCAA Football Stadium which includes infrastructure, new artificial field, modular seating, modular locker rooms/restrooms/showers/changing facilities, scoreboard and press box. The current grandstands offer seating capacity at around 5,000 seats. Project will consist of adding an additional 17,000 seats. Prequalification applications due by: Wednesday, October 1, 2025 at 5:00pm Firms must have approval letter by: October 9, 2025 Estimated Design and Construction Cost: $ $171,240,000.00 Contractor License Requirement: B CSU Point of Contact for Information: Joy Sissom (joy.sissom@csus.edu) (916) 278-2815 . RFQ Respondents Conference and Site Inspection Mandatory: Date and Time: Friday, October 10, 2025, at 9:00am Only Prequalified firms will be invited to the conference. Location: 1600 Exposition Blvd, Sacramento, CA 95815 ¿ Gate 12 For directions call (916) 278-2815 To search for and view this project advertisement, Respondents shall register and log in on the ¿California State Contracts Register¿ (CSCR) at California State Government Marketplace. If Respondent experiences problems viewing this website, contact the CSU point of contact named above for assistance. Request for Qualifications (RFQ) documents will be available on or after October 14, 2025 on the ¿PlanetBids Public Solicitation Portal¿ website, http://psp.planetbids.com/g/81563/. Respondents shall first register as a vendor and then log in to the PlanetBids Public Solicitation Portal to search for this project and download the RFQ documents. If Respondent experiences problems viewing this website, contact the CSU point of contact named above for assistance. Respondents must be financially prequalified with the Trustees. To do so, submit the prequalification applications by October 1, 2025 at 5:00pm. Respondents shall go to the following PlanetBids website to register, log in and then select the Prequalification tab to apply. ¿California State University, Office of the Chancellor, Vendor Portal¿ (https://www.planetbids.com/portal/portal.cfm?CompanyID=15331) Direct any prequalification questions to the Trustees¿ Prequalification Administrator at cocm.prequal@calstate.edu. The Trustees shall give a small business a bid advantage of five percent up to a maximum of $50,000 to contracting firms that have been certified as a ¿Small Business¿ by the Department of General Services, Office of Small Business and DVBE Services, in accordance with Contract General Conditions (and Supplementary General Conditions) for Collaborative Design-Build Major Projects, Article 32.10, Small Business Five Percent Bid Advantage. Additionally, the Trustees require three percent Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise (DVBE) participation in all contracts, in accordance with Contract General Conditions (and Supplementary General Conditions) for Collaborative Design-Build Major Projects, Article 32.12-g, DVBE Incentive. DVBE Participation Incentive 3.00% to 3.99% None 4.00% to 4.99% 1% 5.00% to 5.99% 2% 6.00% or more 3% When it nears time to bid trades, the selected design-builder shall contact the Trustees¿ DVBE Coordinator Shon Tilby, at (916) 278-5797, shon.tilby@csus.edu. Respondents shall be familiar with all the provisions of the Contract General Conditions and Supplementary General Conditions, especially the Insurance Requirements for the CSU Builders Risk Insurance Program (BRIP) and for the CSU Owner-Controlled Insurance Program (OCIP). This project will be enrolled into the BRIP, and may be enrolled into the OCIP, if the Construction Value is ten million dollars or more. If OCIP is applicable to this project, Bidders may review OCIP documents online at www.calstate.edu/ConstructionInsurancePrograms. Contractor shall possess an Experience Modification Rate (EMR) of 1.0 or lower. Failure to provide evidence of an EMR of 1.0 or lower may render the bid as non-responsive. Subcontractors shall possess an EMR of 1.25 or lower to participate in this project. Failure to provide evidence of an EMR of 1.25 or lower may render the bid as non-responsive. This Project is a public works project and is subject to prevailing wage rate laws (Contract General Conditions, Article 36.02). All Respondents/Proposers and all tiers of subcontractors who will work on this Project shall register to bid and work on public works projects with the Dept. of Industrial Relations (DIR), and maintain current this registration per Labor Code section 1725.5. For more information, go to http://www.dir.ca.gov/Public-Works/PublicWorks.html THE Notice To Contractors is attached in the attachment section.

Event Name: ATM Space Available in Secure & Populated Downtown Sacramento Government Building
Description: The California Department of General Services (DGS), Facilities Management Division (FMD), hereinafter referred to as State, invites you to review and welcomes proposals for the ATM space located at the California Natural Resources Building (CNRA) at 715 P Street, Sacramento, Sacramento County, California. The ATM area is ten (10) square feet (SQ FT) and located on the first floor of the CNRA. The State is seeking an Automated Teller Machine (ATM) services (here after referred to as ¿Awarded Bidder¿) for employees and visitors of the CNRA. DGS¿ interpretation of ATM services may include, but is not limited to withdrawal of money, cash deposit, and check deposit. Awarded Bidder shall maintain a high level of customer service at all times. DGS¿ satisfaction must be a priority. Proposal Submission Information Please take the time to carefully read and become familiar with the proposal requirements. In submitting your proposal, you must comply with the instructions herein. All proposals submitted for consideration must be received by the date as specified on the cover page labeled ¿SUBMISSION DUE DATE¿. The State may not consider any proposal in which material/information requested is not furnished or where unclear or incomplete information is provided. Prospective Bidders are hereby notified that this award shall be made in the best interest of the State and the State reserves the right to reject any and all proposals received in response to this request. The Awarded Bidder has the opportunity to service the ATM during non-business hours. The awarded bidder is fully responsible to abide by the terms of the License while working in the building during non-business hours.

Event Name: Adult Education Professional Development - CN260001 RFP
Description: The California Department of Education (CDE), Career and College Transition Division (CCTD), Adult Education Office (AEO) is seeking proposals from eligible bidders who can design, implement, and operate a large-scale, statewide professional development project that supports high performing literacy and basic skills adult education programs. The adult education programs this project supports include: English Language Acquisition (ELA), also commonly known as English as a Second Language (ESL); Adult Basic Education (ABE); Adult Secondary Education (ASE), which includes High School Diploma and High School Equivalency; and Integrated English Literacy and Civics Education (IELCE), which includes Integrated Education and Training (IET). The CDE is releasing this Request for Proposals (RFP) for the purpose of contracting with a provider for professional development. Bidders are required to submit an Intent to Submit a Proposal, by mail or email that must be received by November 19, 2025, at 5:00 pm PDT. The Intent to Submit a Proposal does not require an organization to submit a proposal however, a proposal will not be accepted unless an Intent to Submit a Proposal is submitted on time. Please do not submit your questions to this Fi$Cal advertisement; instead, you must formally submit your questions in writing to Jennifer Boone, Career and College Transition Division, by email at jboone@cde.ca.gov, or by mail. All questions must be submitted to the CDE by November 19, 2025, at 5:00 pm PDT. Please refer to the Request for Proposal (RFP), Section 2.6, Questions and Clarifications. You can obtain a copy of this RFP on the CDE Funding Web page at: https://www.cde.ca.gov/fg/fo/r8/aepd26rfp.asp
